categories: Category:Ships of the Open Circle Fleet

nodes.text: The Steadfast was a Venator-class Star Destroyer that served in the Galactic Republic naval forces' Open Circle Fleet during the Clone Wars, as well as the flagship of Zabrak Jedi Master Eeth Koth. In 21 BBY, the Steadfast was ambushed by a Recusant-class light destroyer commanded by the Kaleesh Separatist General Grievous in the Saleucami system. During the battle, the Kaleesh and several BX-series droid commandos boarded the Star Destroyer and engaged Koth's clone troopers, who subsequently escaped the vessel, allowing Grievous and his droids to make their to the command bridge to engage Koth.

Aboard the bridge, Grievous breached the sealed doors and sent his commando droids in to engage Koth. However, the Jedi was able to destroy the droids, which were subsequently replaced by a team of four IG-100 MagnaGuards, who assisted Grievous in dueling the Zabrak. Outnumbered and overwhelmed, the Kaleesh and his bodyguards managed to defeat and take Koth captive aboard the Separatist destroyer.

As a Venator-class Star Destroyer, the Steadfast had two bridges and a broadside port that could be boarded via docking tube, and was also equipped with escape pods and engine units. Either side of the Steadfast's hull was plastered with the emblem of the Open Circle Fleet.

In 21 BBY, during the Clone Wars between the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems, the Steadfast and its commander, Jedi Master Eeth Koth, in the Saleucami system, came under attack by the Kaleesh Separatist General Grievous aboard a Recusant-class light destroyer. After suffering damage to its hull in the oncoming fire from the destroyer, the Separatist command ship moved to a docking port on the Venator's broadside and then proceeded to extend its docking tube to the Star Destroyer in order for Separatist droids to board the vessel.

Upon boarding the Star Destroyer, BX-series droid commandos engaged Koth's clone troopers stationed aboard, led by Clone Captain Lock. However, as the battle aboard the Venator ensued, the Jedi Master ordered Lock and his troopers to make their escape via the escape pods, where Koth awaited Grievous and his accompanying droids aboard the command bridge alongside his remaining troopers.

Reaching the bridge, the Kaleesh used his lightsabers to breach the sealed command center and send his commando droids in to engage Koth and dispatch his remaining troopers. However, despite the loss of his troopers, Koth was able to eliminate the commando droids, but was engaged by Grievous and a team of four IG-100 MagnaGuards in a brief duel shortly after. Amid their duel, the MagnaGuards used their electrostaffs to weaken the Jedi Master, who became overwhelmed by Grievous and the droids, allowing the Kaleesh to defeat and take Koth captive aboard his destroyer to the planet Saleucami.

The Steadfast first appeared in "Grievous Intrigue," the ninth episode of the animated television series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' second season, which aired on January 1, 2010. It was later first identified in the 2015 reference book Ultimate Star Wars, published by Dorling Kindersley.
